RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 7F Dirt CR: 57. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligib ility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TIZBIT stalked off the rail on the first turn, coasted to the lead approaching the seven sixteenths pole and cleared Moiraine toward the three eighths, came under pressure into the far turn and contested the edge, raced clear leaving the furlong pole and was kept alert through the lane. MY SISTER PAM raced in the three path the first turn, picked up the chase approaching the three eighths pole and contested at a close disadvantage two deep on the far turn, but dropped back past the eighth pole and just lasted for second. WICKED WISDOM saved ground on the first turn then eased out and gave chase into the backstretch, raced in the three path on the far turn, drifted leaving the turn but came back to finish well and just missed second. BOCA BIRDIE saved ground on the opening turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the three path of the far turn and ran evenly in the lane. PRETTY SPECTACULAR had a brief early lead inside, stalked through the first turn then faded through the backstretch. MOIRAINE closed to the lead nearing the three quarter pole and rated the pace, was met toward the seven sixteenths and faded through the backstretch.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 64. Claiming Purse 11800. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 26 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SULTRY SALLY H took the lead soon after the start and rated the pace inside, came under pressure approaching the quarter pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and was kept sharp through the lane. MIDNIGHT REGRET rounded the opening turn about the three path, started a bid leaving the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and ran evenly to mid-stretch before flattening stride. SISTER SPIRIT saved ground on the first turn, picked up the chase approaching the three eighths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn and showed little further. ULTIMATE BREEZE saved ground on the first turn, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path and flattened in the lane. IRISH SAMURAI raced in the four path the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path and weakened in the lane. I B NASTY saved ground early then angled out into the backstretch, showed little response and raced wide on the far turn. CHARLOTTE WEBLEY was through after a half mile.

ENTRY.NAME: I B Nasty
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,angled out 1/2,little response,wide far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Sultry Sally H
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 1/4,rail turn,kept sharp lane

ENTRY.NAME: Sister Spirit
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 3/8,rail far turn,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: Midnight Regret
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3p 1st turn,bid past 3/8,off rail far turn,evenly to 1/16,flatten

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 68. Claiming Purse 11800. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 26 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RUNNING FREE was urged clear nearing the three eighths pole and tapered in to show the way, came under pressure and widened near the rail on the turn, drifted into the lane and was kept alert to the wire. SEEMS TO WHISPER gave chase, raced off the rail on the turn and ran evenly down the lane. SWEET SPIN gave chase, closed to a boxed in position and was roughed at the rail approaching the quarter pole, angled to the six path through the turn and finished evenly to take third later yards. HOWSAFEAREMYCOLORS chased toward the outside, raced in the five path on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. DAPPLESANDDIAMONDS gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path then flattened in the lane. GRAM'S GAL gave chase inside, raced at the rail on the turn and weakened in the stretch. KYMMIES CHARDONNAY chased inside, rounded the turn near the rail and weakened. SMOOKIE steadied at the start, gave early chase outside then saved some ground on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Sweet Spin
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,closed to box near 1/4,angled out,even finish for 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Seems to Whisper
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Cefalu John

ENTRY.NAME: Smookie
ENTRY.COMMENT: steadied start,chased outside early,saved some ground turn

ENTRY.NAME: Running Free
ENTRY.COMMENT: urged clear near 3/8,tapered in,widened turn,drifted,kept alert

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 66. Claiming Purse 15700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eli gibility)(Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RIVER REWARDS RVF gave chase, raced at even terms nearest the rail on the turn and dug in determinedly to eke out the advantage over the game stretch challenge of PURE NONSENSE, who pressured the pace and took a slim lead between horses nearing the quarter pole, but was outfinished in the duel through the stretch. CEDAR'S WISH chased inside through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn and held on for third in the duel through the stretch. SIENTE LA BRISA broke a step slow then chased inside, steadied and angled off the rail leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the turn about the five path and was outfinished for third. RISKSRHIGHPAYISLOW chased toward the outside, rounded the turn about the five path then lugged in while flattening stride in the lane. I'M A TOTAL DIVA set a pressured early pace, was met approaching the quarter pole, faded readily on the turn and was eased in the lane.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 7F Dirt CR: 83. Claiming Purse 12700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE FEBRUARY 26, 2023. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since February 26 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered F or $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ELVIRUS saved ground off the pace, started a bid toward the seven sixteenths pole and drew close two deep approaching the eighth pole, dug in for the lead mid-stretch and moved away later yards. SCOTTSDALE took the lead and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure approaching the quarter pole, was met nearing mid-stretch and had to settle for second. MOON OVER MONTANA raced two deep on the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the half mile pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and came along for third later yards. INDIANA RED raced in the three path on the opening turn, gave chase past the half mile pole and was in range of the lead in the four path on the far turn, but flattened in the lane. MAKE WAY saved ground on the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. MAGICAL EXPRESS stalked the early pace, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole but weakened off the rail on the far turn. RIGHTEOUS MAN broke a step slow and never factored. YABBA DABBA DUDE was never a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Moon Over Montana
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2d 1st turn,chased past 1/2,off rail far turn,along 3rd later yds

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 58. Claiming Purse 11800. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 26 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WISHING FOR SPRING was reluctant to load then stalked in the three path the first turn, edge closer leaving the turn, rallied to the front three wide past the quarter pole, raced clear into the lane and held on under steady handling. JACKYSINTHECASTLE stalked two deep then challenged leaving the seven sixteenths pole, took a brief slim lead past the five sixteenths pole but was met into the far turn, continued close off the rail through the turn, dug in to clear second later yards and was gaining on the winner. WAGER WORTHY bobbled leaving the gate but was hustled along the rail with the early lead and rated the pace into the first turn, came under pressure at the seven sixteenths pole, gave up the lead past the five sixteenths, stayed close at the rail through the far turn then flattened toward mid-stretch. SARAH'S WARRIOR rated close inside, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced close in the four path on the far turn and ran evenly in the stretch. WOODSONG'S CASTLE raced well off the pace and left the first turn outside, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the six path and finished evenly to pass rivals. LADY SPARROW was blocked through the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail then weakened. BLUE MOUNTAIN rounded the first turn about the four path, gave chase from the three eighths pole but weakened in the four path on the far turn. PEARLY GHOST raced in the three path the first turn, gave chase from the three eighths pole then weakened in the three path on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Wishing for Spring
ENTRY.COMMENT: reluctant load,stalked 3p,edged close,up 3wd past 1/4,held on drv

ENTRY.NAME: Pearly Ghost
ENTRY.OWNER: Mountain View Racing LLC and Golden Melinda B

ENTRY.NAME: Woodsong's Castle
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace,outside 1/2,chased 7/16,6p far turn,even finish

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 71. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 26 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 26 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,50 0 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TURTLE DOVE gave chase through the backstretch, raced close in the three path on the turn, dug in for the lead mid-stretch and edged clear later yards. CHASENJOHNATHAN gave chase through the backstretch, entered the turn off the rail, moved to the inside midway through the turn then angled out leaving the turn and dug in to take second the final stride. CATS DIAMOND BOY took over at the half mile pole and rated the pace, came under pressure leaving the three eighths, contested the advantage nearest the rail on the turn, dug in under steady encouragement leaving the turn but was caught mid-stretch and relented later yards. GEORGE chased through the backstretch, raced close at the rail on the turn then flattened later yards. ONE CANDY CASTLE gave chase inside, raced off the rail on the turn, eased out entering the stretch but showed little further. DONNIE B chased inside, raced near the rail on the turn and showed little in the lane. KAYLEE'S SPITFIRE chased through the backstretch and raced in the six and seven paths on the turn. SPARKED A NOTION saved ground. BORN TO SIN became a bit edgy in the gate, gave chase through the backstretch then flattened in the four path on the turn. IN HIGH GEAR broke clear then chased outside, raced in the seven path on the turn and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: One Candy Castle
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,off rail turn,eased out 1/8,little further

ENTRY.NAME: Cats Diamond Boy
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace,pressured 3/8,rail turn,dug in lane,relented later yds

ENTRY.NAME: Chasenjohnathan
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,off rail into turn,eased out 1/8,up 2nd final stride

ENTRY.NAME: Turtle Dove
ENTRY.OWNER: CM Racing and Jones Jr Michael E

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 43. Maiden Claiming Purse 13000. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500, if for $7,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SMOKIN LADY closed to the lead approaching the three eighths pole, drew away at the rail on the turn and was hand ridden most of the stretch. LOCKDOWN VANNA gave chase, rounded the turn near the rail and dug in through the lane to hold second. LADY GANGSTER chased the early pace inside, rounded most of the turn off the rail but angled to the five path into the lane and flattened stride inside the sixteenth pole. JUNIPER GRACE chased outside, rounded the turn about the six path and passed some rivals. VIESTE gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn and ran evenly in the stretch. PLAYING FOR TWO exchanged contact with Miracle Sonde leaving the gate, gave chase through the backstretch and raced in the eight path on the turn. BOWMANS LAZY GIRL was hustled along with a brief early lead, gave chase toward the three eighths pole, rounded the turn off the rail and weakened in the lane. MIRACLE SONDE exchanged contact with Playing For Two leaving the gate, gave chase through the backstretch and rounded the turn about the seven path. OWLHOOT saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Smokin Lady
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: up near 3/8,drew away rail turn,hand urged most of lane
